'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': 'Normally, a radar chart includes specific indicators. However, in certain cases, some indicators may not be available and thus have null values. These should not be simply treated as 0 because doing so would make it impossible to distinguish between actual zero values and missing data, which could represent anomalies. Given this issue, a new component library has been adopted to display the radar chart in order to better handle such scenarios where indicators might be missing or unavailable.\n\ufeff\nThis approach ensures that missing data points are appropriately represented without conflating them with valid zero values, thereby providing clearer insights into the underlying data and making it easier to identify potential anomalies. By switching to a more capable component library, you can implement more sophisticated handling of missing data, improving the accuracy and interpretability of your radar charts.\n\ufeff\nIf there is a need to display null values as 0, this can be achieved by modifying the data source or by providing a toggle in the component to allow users to decide whether null values should be shown as 0. This approach avoids a one-size-fits-all solution that automatically treats all null values as 0, giving users the flexibility to handle missing data according to their specific needs.\n\ufeff\nThis method ensures that users can choose the most appropriate way to represent missing data, either displaying null values as 0 when it makes sense for their use case, or leaving them as null to clearly indicate the absence of data. By offering such an option, the component becomes more versatile and better suited to different data visualization requirements.', 'reactions': {'url': Right now, I'm forced to squeeze everything into a single timeline, limiting the flexibility of the visualization.\n\nFor example, one timeline could control a line chart showing revenue growth (yearly progression), while another controls a pie chart updating with market share data at different points in time. Without multiple timelines, I have to hack my way around, often relying on `universalTransition` as a workaround, which adds unnecessary complexity and doesn't always produce the intended effect.", 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': 'Having two independent charts, each with its own `timeline`, is indeed a workaround—but it comes with its own set of drawbacks.\n\nFirst, it would require creating an additional `echartsinstance`, which increases memory usage and computational overhead, especially in complex dashboards. Managing multiple instances also means handling event synchronization manually if interactions are needed between charts.\n\nSecond, even if I stick to one instance, I would have to swap option configurations dynamically to mimic independent timelines. This means manually reconfiguring series, axes, and other chart elements on every timeline tick—effectively reconstructing parts of the chart instead of smoothly updating them.\n\nThis extra complexity adds unnecessary processing time and increases implementation effort, all for something that could be elegantly solved with a `timelineIndex` property within options.series. If axes, legends, and grids can be indexed, why not timelines? It would provide a much cleaner and more efficient solution.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2704775007/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'2025-02-26T03:12:50Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "Thank you @sz-p , `tooltip.textStyle.lineHeight: 10` works for now. However, I have also noticed the `lineHeight` property could be ditched if not needed. Instead defining `tooltip.textStyle.fontSize` property works for now as well. \nMoreover, looking forward to a proper fix.  Sharing some probable workaround to the problem below:\n\n### Workaround:\n```js\noption = {\n  xAxis: {\n    type: 'category',\n    data: ['Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun']\n  },\n  yAxis: {\n    type: 'value'\n  },\n  series: [\n    {\n      data: [150, 230, 224, 218, 135, 147, 260],\n      type: 'line'\n    }\n  ],\n  // Extended config from the example\n  tooltip: {\n    trigger: 'axis',\n    textStyle: {\n      // ✘ Do not use the `lineHeight` property as it resets the padding.\n      // lineHeight: 1, \n      /**\n       * ✔ workaround (1): If the `lineHeight` is needed use a greater value.\n       * As `lineHeight: 10` is used instead of 1. Feel free to tweak the value\n       * to suffice your need.\n       */\n      // lineHeight: 10,\n      /**\n       * ✔ workaround (2): If the `lineHeight` property could be avoided use\n       * a `fontSize` property. As semantic conventions still follows here.\n       */\n      fontSize: 12,\n    }\n  }\n};\n```\n\n**Ref:** [Echart tooltip line height issue workaround.](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=line-simple&code=PYBwLglsB2AEC8sDeAoWsAeBBDEDOAXMmurGAJ4gCmRA5AMYCGYVA5sAE7m0A0J6AE2aMiAbVoBZGL1i0AKgFcqM2gHUqAlXIAWClQDEOEFQGVmphdFoBdEgF8-6cjnxFUpMpRqyAbowA2SrT2jrB4VEZUhLCi_MQegsJiAIwArAAMPLAATADMmTnZACxZ2ckAHFnJualVRQDspQBs6dahHhTUdP4Q0MpxdiRtJAD0I7AAohgs0AIasPQwAGYQrLBLHMAAtmTaVLBUGIxbIP5UJGDAwP6QIG5xYEasrBF0jLh4vA-HYCYUZ_cErAxrBABjksAAIsBYNBgGBYApwrt9gADHp9AASVFW2jAKNgIE21A4FFgjDwsAg8I4USoYApYD2BMYAgEvVYADo4ugQeiqFicWAiMkstzgQAqcVi2Di2CAFHJYAB3TgAa0Ym0sAlgAApkgBKIgASSWyNgaN6_OxrFx-PwMKoGnmiP2jFgrBpzAisD8gSoXKBMtgWAp5sxVtxwvStopzq1vTwLBZsGAJuSHNg-gd_nWNP2lzIiqojBVpp9SmlsvzeAUSxW9H25GACg49o0_qB4pGYt5FoF1qFsGSmW7kor8qVqvVTdmOuyBtgxtNoctgvxhNAEVJiwU_i1ACMXT5gBA5lrnWPXSiljBfhAAF5UNdEzfkdPBsJULaMaCQegLGA-FQP5QNAFIJhA_jZtekHAIqFJ7DS7YJJ2YrXj-Jj3t4yTZO0sCDOggx2AA3EAA)\n\n**Image:**\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c2540855-4466-4431-b42a-c301f08604b7)\n\n\n\n\n\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2683782152/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

```toBuffer(\'image/png\')```.\nAlso add ```animation:false``` in option, it\'s a semi-documented **solution** to the problem, see similar #20783.\nI tested with following code and it works.\n```\ncanvas = document.createElement("canvas");\ncanvas.width = 640;\ncanvas.height = 480;\nmyChart = echarts.init(canvas)\nmyChart.setOption(option)\nconst dataURL = canvas.toDataURL(\'image/png\');\n\n// Create a temporary link element to trigger the download\nconst link = document.createElement(\'a\');\nlink.href = dataURL;\nlink.download = \'canvas_image.png\'; // Set the file name for the download\ndocument.body.appendChild(link);\nlink.click();\ndocument.body.removeChild(link);\n```', 'reactions': {'url': As a workaround, you can disable CSS animation by\n\n**1. Disable animation for the scatter series** \n```js\nseries:[{ type: 'scatter', data:[2, 3], animation: false }]\n```\n\n**2. Render to SVG string without CSS animation support**\n```js\nmyChart.getZr().painter.renderToString({\n  cssAnimation: false\n});\n```", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2677766642/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 1, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'2025-03-10T06:46:21Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "> When category value is `null` or `undefined` when not using dataset, it's considered as a string `'null'` and `'undefined'` so I think maybe it's best to align this behavior to this?\r\n> \r\n> ```js\r\n> option = {\r\n>   xAxis: {\r\n>     type: 'category',\r\n>     data: ['Mon', null, undefined, 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun']\r\n>   },\r\n>   yAxis: {\r\n>     type: 'value'\r\n>   },\r\n>   series: [\r\n>     {\r\n>       data: [150, 230, 224, 218, 135, 147, 260],\r\n>       type: 'line'\r\n>     }\r\n>   ]\r\n> };\r\n> ```\r\n> \r\n> The result of this PR is an empty string as category value now.\r\n\r\nI actually prefer the current behavior of `dataset/encode` where `null/undefined` values are rendered as empty strings. \r\n`null/undefined` are JavaScript keywords that represent empty or missing values, an empty string is more intuitive in most contexts.\r\n\r\nChanging it could lead to unexpected issues when users upgrade to a new version.\r\nThey would need to implement additional logic to hide `null/undefined` values or consider i18n.\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': I was trying to create something like this:\n\ncorrect, no equivalent. The closest analog in ECharts is sunburst.label.rotate 'tangential' [official example](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=sunburst-label-rotate), and [pie.label.rotate](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-pie.label.rotate).\nYou could change your title from [Bug] to [Feature] and rephrase it.  \nThis would be also a good feature for the proposed [new radar chart](https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/19182).\n\nBTW, there is a crazy 🤪 workaround with a superimposed pie just for the rotated labels - [Demo](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=radar&_mBkAAhCRgMmwxmQWASBjIGjVckQQ5UG5KZy4BAxQLVch4WXIAzgxC_THgKBwJDsbi6AByhXwTFxAHdyD4GExSKrcIamCEoDtleb4Fb9FIFMgqcgnQAZaAIkbK_24D1exBSdhRjagYOh-iUG30O3dXC4PyIAL_TW2URoAB8hYA9NI2v7rrhVXbEMBmPT_XgI2s-lyeftbEw4WKdZLM1nYAkxR51dtTG2aXTMG38vOs-j6QAWeY2DLnZDrrdpM42fc2aStYQ3IdZrO9DxMllwUjszu8qiLh0Xj5vt_LzD79jSFcLWYTxsWYrC3NcAMrU9zzfK8NAFIV6BFfsJSOF822lC9X1bD8RzHahqkbUw9BhdRDh-ZArGg-gQzDZQ6iYYBXhAVFQAYsBSFMRB4Fpf5UVpQ5yUCBhTEgGIkFRABiawqGJN91WAUp6REKhLH4ABSKV2FE2JNSofQCSYaptkEtg2yjABRYgXgSIpgEQSByLTDNkAc-BIB2C1dAoJzSGgmdKFACBWSQaslGlOQ7iAA).\n\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/51f64337-7193-4825-a51c-84fc6285b866)", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2672813588/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-25T18:26:59Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-25T18:26:59Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '@uhafner, ECharts API says that [color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) could be defined by a **string** in three formats: \'rgb(255,0,0)\', \'#ff0000\' or \'red\'. So when you use ```color: "oklch(50% 0.2155 150deg)"``` ECharts considers it an invalid **string** and ignores it. I do not know if or when _oklch_ color format will be supported in ECharts.\n\nI made an effort in my Demo above to search, adapt, test and share a conversion **function** _ok2rgb_. It uses the **absolute** value syntax of _oklch_ to convert LCH values to color format \'rgb()\' The [relative value syntax](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value/oklch) you are using ```oklch(from oklch(...)...)``` is not supported. But you are welcome to enhance _ok2rgb_ and make it work with relative syntax as well. And if you are successful, please share.\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2682929381/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2683062782', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20757#issuecomment-2683062782', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20757', 'id': 2683062782, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6f7En-', 'user': {'login': 'uhafner', 'id': 503338, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjUwMzMzOA==', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/503338?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/uhafner', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/uhafner/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-25T19:27:40Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-25T19:27:40Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': ">  I do not know if or when oklch color format will be supported in ECharts.\n\nBut isn't this exactly what this issue is about: a feature request for ECharts to fully support oklch? \n\n> I made an effort in my Demo above to search\n\nYes, thanks for the snippet, this is a valid workaround until oklch is supported by ECharts. Maybe developers can explain, I can\'t even find the file where colors are interpreted...\n\nEcharts can indeed show oklch color, but the problem is on the highlight/emphasis when the user hovers on the chart. The current workaround is to disable the `emphasis` completely.  https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/19976\n\nI think the problem is on [zrender](https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender), the library used by echarts to render the charts.\n\nHere is the code to apply emphasis styles https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/blob/master/src/svg/cssEmphasis.ts. \n\n```\n...\n            const emphasisStyle = el.states.emphasis && el.states.emphasis.style\n                ? el.states.emphasis.style\n                : {};\n            let fill = emphasisStyle.fill;\n            if (!fill) {\n                // No empahsis fill, lift color\n                const normalFill = el.style && el.style.fill;\n                const selectFill = el.states.select\n                    && el.states.select.style\n                    && el.states.select.style.fill;\n                const fromFill = el.currentStates.indexOf(\'select\') >= 0\n                    ? (selectFill || normalFill)\n                    : normalFill;\n                if (fromFill) {\n                    fill = liftColor(fromFill);\n                }\n            }\n...\n```\n\nAnd [here](https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/blob/master/src/tool/color.ts#L576) is where the new color calculated.', 'reactions': {'url': https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/blob/aa7187279fb306e12f3984f6f7f7fd4134635aea/src/tool/color.ts#L162 I see _rgb_ and _hsl_ formats checked, but no trace of _oklch_ in the entire repo. Mystery remains unsolved, at least to me...\n> \n> UPDATE: looks like color string falls back to a CSS definition somehow. So all [CSS color spaces](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Color_space) are supported, not only _oklch_:\n> \n> ```\n>     'color(rec2020 0.2 0.2 0.8)',\n>     'color(xyz 1 1 1 )', //transparent\n>     'color(display-p3 1 0.5 0)',\n>     'lch(from hsl(0 100% 50%) 29.6871% 66.83 327.109)',\n>     'lab(50% -120 125)',\n>     'hwb(50deg 30% 40%)',\n>     'oklab(from hsl(180 100% 50%) calc(l - 0.1) a b)',\n> ```\n\nThat's not a mystery. According to browser's spec, both the [canvas API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillStyle#value) and [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fill) support CSS color values for fills. \n\nGood job @helgasoft  💯  on finding the workaround with `color: inherit`", 'reactions': 'updated_at': '2025-03-02T08:50:15Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "For those wondering how `color: inherit` fixes this issue:  \n\nAccording to the [ECharts documentation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-line.emphasis.itemStyle.color):  \n\n> Since v5.2.0, it can be set to 'inherit' in the emphasis state to disable color highlight.  \n\nBy using `color: inherit`, we effectively prevent ECharts from applying its default color highlight.  \n\nTo mimic the default highlight effect, we can instead adjust the [opacity](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-line.emphasis.itemStyle.opacity). The default behavior replaces the color with a lighter RGB color instead of modifying opacity, which unfortunately does not support the OKLCH color space.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2692627619/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

But by doing this the data doesn't even render.\n\nagree, it seems series with _calendar_ coordinates do not play well with _dataset_ and _encode_.\nYour example demonstrates how _encode_ does **not** work, but _dimensions_ (which is not even in the docs!?) is **mandatory** 😲\n```encode: {time: 'time', value: 'value', tooltip: ['value', 'something_else']}``` is perfectly valid setting/expectation.\nSo I would say this issue is not about adding a new feature, but about fixing a **bug** 🐛 - [Demo](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=calendar-heatmap&edit=1&reset=1&code=PYBwLglsB2AEC8sDeAoWtJgDYFMBcya6GoBAzAAwA0R6uAZmAQOQDGO0YOATszcbADOAVwBGXAB5NYAImYdWwACY5msegEMIWQVVjDoS4K2EBbDlyWxmSiOeiCoDtQHdg3ANaDYEB1w1KMkQAvvwkwFiQIARIsKFEAG4QIhpYALIa0YQCphoS5NS0sKa-BBQhYaypHEoa3DFFYKSwAIwATIUCDNKUYejcEADmABY9ncTcGtCD-NYdbQCsfEUQXKYAymAAnrgNAuii7ircAOoQSmDDZQB0C0XxAls4dQAyGqI4WDFCw8AuBGBuMIcHEKkRBDwIDhBHtiNsQLNmMNnmBciA-LAioojr4NFx1ltBGsWFVcIY6ssBLZ7I4YDDYABtGx41R6ZgJVLA5gAXT0AHo-cVhET9BCfH5nlZgPRYAplCCAIQAfgVRQAcgB5OUqWECAWQcwsWpcDEcrDAlhmrl6IroA2zaiwK2zFp6JoRKIENr3PrhSIQLKofbqdy5MBceqwAAUFm4WwAlAgAHzZYOwbg4MDCbhwZi4cM8FiwADUss4ceuxo0DLa3IA3LbQQJgmCiFWIdIGUHiIJgNn2AAJSWF9SpCG-gXUji0hwEJnG1nWZ0Y5iSMA8329_uzBmNpnzBYAWhax5XLQAbCvVLy98wD4e2qe2S0WiuJBvb_eyE_rGRX2yNA_YN9woRZDwAFh_ZgWjIFdWB5IpuRCJDgjrIA)\nYou may change the title accordingly.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2698999852/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 1, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

I will keep that in mind next time...\n\nYes you are absolutely correct: the `appendData` combined with `refresh` is much faster in this use case (compared to `setOption`).  It works very smooth that way.\n\nAnd yes indeed your demo code works fine by refreshing everytime a new datapoint is appended to the chart.  But imho it is a large overhead (from a performance point of view) to refresh the chart every 10 msecs (when a new datapoint arrives).  This becomes even more important when the number of datapoints in the chart or the rate of appending datapoints increases further.   It seems to be very inefficient to me to refresh the chart more often as your eye can see.  I hope you understand my concern...  \n\nTherefore I tried to reduce the number of refreshes e.g. once every 500 milliseconds (i.e. when 50 datapoints have been appended).  I had expected to see every 500 milliseconds the latest 50 new datapoints to be appended to the chart, but for some reason the chart keeps flickering.  I also noticed that you have used `animation: false` in your demo, but when I try to add that to my demo code the flickering isn't solved...\n\nI agree with you that adding a new feature for this might be complete overhead.  But it would be nice if we could refresh the chart at lower rates.  If you would have any tips I could try to do this properly, that would be very much appreciated!", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2645939590/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2646611682', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20739#issuecomment-2646611682', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20739', 'id': 2646611682, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6dwBbi', 'user': {'login': 'helgasoft', 'id': 13038071, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDM4MDcx', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13038071?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/helgasoft', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-09T21:37:03Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-09T21:37:03Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "> reduce the number of refreshes e.g. once every 500 milliseconds (i.e. when 50 datapoints have been appended). \n\nThis is possible, but there may be a bug for ```type='line'```. Thanks!!\n\n> See also my Demo in related https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/18742,\n\nYes you correct, that looks very smooth.  And you even use `setOption` instead of `appendData`, which kind of surprises me that this works so well: because in my tests the `setOption` was horrible slow compared to `appendData`.  I thought it was because Echarts then need to calculate the delta itself, so it has to compare all the datapoints to figure out at the end that only a single datapoint has been appended.  But perhaps I am completely misunderstanding the entire concept then...\n\n> You may consider collecting new data and appending it only once within your preferred interval.  Just like this demo.\n\n@Justin-ZS \nThanks for joining here!\nAah, why didn\'t think about that myself...  \nYes your demo contains a decent workaround.  That way our application is in control of when the re-rendering needs to happen.\nNice one!  I am certainly going to use this as a workaround.\nAlthough it would be still nice if some day somebody could fix the original refresh issue...', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2647074395/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2635262802', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20731#issuecomment-2635262802', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20731', 'id': 2635262802, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6dEutS', 'user': {'login': 'helgasoft', 'id': 13038071, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDM4MDcx', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13038071?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/helgasoft', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/helgasoft/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-02-04T23:05:56Z', 'updated_at': '2025-02-04T23:23:20Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': 'one [possible solution](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=line-simple&-LXAHUzWkedKg9JPIZ6fIwMCSFCmsAzNyMIA)\nAnd here is the answer from [DeepSeek](https://chat.deepseek.com/).  Hmm, better than mine.\n```\n  tooltip: {\n    trigger: "axis",\n    formatter: (arr) => {\n      const dataIndex = arr[0].dataIndex; // Current x-axis index\n      const xCategory = option.xAxis.data[dataIndex]; // x-axis label (e.g., \'Mon\')\n      let content = `${xCategory}<br/>`; // Start building the tooltip content\n  \n      // Loop through all series in the option\n      option.series.forEach((series) => {\n        const value = series.data[dataIndex] ?? \'N/A\'; // Use \'N/A\' if data is missing\n        content += `${series.name}: ${value}<br/>`; // Add series name and value\n      });\n  \n      return content;\n    }\n  }\n```', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2635262802/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, is another possible workaround which takes advantage of echarts standard formatters by only modifying the visuals of legend items and series. The basic idea is to keep track of the state of selected series yourself and set the echarts legends items always to selected state after a change event. The basic idea is to keep track of the state of selected series yourself and set the echarts legends items always to selected state after a change event. Based on your own state, series color is set to transparent and legend color to grey.\n\nthanks for that, this is a great workaround, though hacky, it solves all the problems, and no data layout issues\nstill, hope echarts will someday have these features builtin, so we could write less code :P', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2645578193/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

This is fine during testing but as @lwangsf mentioned, we are accessing the `Zrender` APIs and data manually which becomes unsafe when further accessed. \nThe example below illustrates my point: \n\nhttps://github.com/user-attachments/assets/03156a23-214d-4eaa-b896-005c44e6004e\n\n```\n      data.eachItemGraphicEl((graphic, index) => {\n        if (typeof graphic.setStyle === 'function') {\n          graphic.setStyle({\n            opacity:\n              dataIndexes.includes(index) || selectedIndexes.includes(index)\n                ? 1\n                : 0.3,\n            // legend highlight should add a stroke when there's an active selection\n            stroke:\n              (dataIndexes.includes(index) && selectedIndexes.length > 0) ||\n              selectedIndexes.includes(index)\n                ? '#000'\n                : '#fff',\n          });\n        } else {\n          graphic._children.map(g => {\n            if (typeof g.setStyle === 'function') {\n              g.setStyle({\n                opacity:\n                  dataIndexes.includes(index) || selectedIndexes.includes(index)\n                    ? 1\n                    : 0.3,\n                // legend highlight should add a stroke when there's an active selection\n                stroke:\n                  (dataIndexes.includes(index) && selectedIndexes.length > 0) ||\n                  selectedIndexes.includes(index)\n                    ? '#000'\n                    : '#fff',\n              });\n            }\n          });\n        }\n```\nKeypoints for the snippet: \n- graphic styles are different for hierarchal data which is why i checked for `function` beforehand \n- we are manually searching for the corresponding data indices in the payload returned from echarts, then matching that with the data indices from the platform (it would be better if there is support to attach the data information)\n- The interaction requires resetting the opacity after as well, again manipulating `Zrender` instead of using the APIs. \n\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2669631035/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

dimension 1 and 2` since one `series` can use only one `dimension`\r\n`using both dimension 1 and 2` is technically impossible, unless you choose to provide a function to aggreagte multiple values", Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2596807541', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20692#issuecomment-2596807541', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20692', 'id': 2596807541, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6ayCN1', 'user': {'login': 'Pritom2357', 'id': 76788332, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjc2Nzg4MzMy', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/76788332?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Pritom2357', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Pritom2357/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-01-16T20:14:25Z', 'updated_at': '2025-01-16T20:14:25Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "\n## Summary\nHi, I’m Pritom Biswas. I’ve been exploring the code base and came across your issue regarding transparent areas in ECharts maps. After some investigation, I believe I have found a fix.\n\n## Root Cause\nYou used `null` for both `areaColor` and `color`, but ECharts expects color values. Setting these properties to `null` causes ECharts to revert to default colors, rather than applying true transparency.\n\n## Proposed Fix\nReplace `null` with `'transparent'`. This ensures that the map polygons remain see-through, while still allowing borders to be visible.\n\nAdditionally, if you need more granular control (for example, customizing opacity or highlighting behavior), you can:\n- Define colors using `rgba(...)` values.\n- Use `itemStyle` for each region in your data array to apply selective coloring or transparency.\n\n## Example\nI’ve created a [[CodePen demo](https://codepen.io/qojayhrk-the-typescripter/pen/mybKazB)](https://codepen.io/qojayhrk-the-typescripter/pen/mybKazB) demonstrating how to use `transparent` and/or `rgba(...)` to control the fill and borders. You’ll find explanatory comments in the code:\n\n```js\n{\n  name: 'Region Name',\n  itemStyle: {\n    color: 'transparent',       \n    borderColor: '#333',       \n    borderWidth: 1\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Conclusion\nUsing `'transparent'` instead of `null` (and optionally `rgba(...)` for more nuanced color control) fixes the issue of keeping polygon borders visible while making the areas fully transparent. If you have any questions or run into any other issues, feel free to let me know!\n\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2596807541/reactions', To make your issue understood by more people and get helped, we'd like to suggest using English next time. 🤗\n<details><summary><b>TRANSLATED</b></summary><br>\n\n**TITLE**\n\n[Feature] Can the graph support dragging multiple nodes at the same time?\n\n**BODY**\n\n### What problem does this feature solve?\n\nBy setting draggable: true, you can drag a node at the same time\nMultiple nodes can be selected by setting selectedMode: 'multiple'\nHowever, these two options do not allow for https://dragselect.com/-like interactions:\n1. Select multiple nodes by dragging and dropping\n2. After selecting multiple nodes, you can move the selected nodes by dragging and dropping\n\n### What does the proposed API look like?\n\nNA\n</details>", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2592135808/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': {'id': 20872, 'client_id': 'Iv1.c20ef54d3abcb0e9', 'slug': 'echarts-bot', 'node_id': 'MDM6QXBwMjA4NzI=', 'owner': {'login': 'Ovilia', 'id': 779050, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjc3OTA1MA==', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/779050?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Ovilia', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'ECharts Bot', 'description': "Hi, I'm a Bot for the ECharts project!\r\n\r\nI'm optimistic, diligent, and always willing to help.\r\nI love pizza, dreaming, and traveling... svg渲染器的压力比canvas是要大一些的，我最后还是用了2\n\n哈哈哈，不要有性能焦虑，现在电脑的性能肯定是妥妥的，svg如果你数据量不大是可以的\n老电脑可能要注意一下，还是看业务场景', 'reactions': {'url': I happened to see your issue and looked at the link you gave.** \r\n\r\nFor your example, I think there are some configuration items that are not very reasonable (there is also a certain possibility that echarts was not designed with 0 in mind). \r\n\r\nFirst, we need to argue that it makes sense to set a minimum angle when the data in the pie chart has a value of 0.From my point of view, if there is an item in the pie chart with a data value of 0, then the minimum angle of the design is redundant, because there is really no need for the value of 0 to be displayed in the pie chart. Of course, this includes what I said about echart, which was not designed with the special value of 0 in mind.\r\n\r\nSecondly, for pie charts, the maximum angle is 360 degrees, and if the angle of the minimum value is set to a static value and this static value is too large, there will be problems. For example, if there are five items in a pie chart, it is mathematically wrong to set the minimum item to an angle of 100, because the minimum angle is 100. Then 100*5>360. Therefore, this minimum angle is best calculated dynamically, and if there is a value of 0 in the data, the minimum angle should be avoided.\r\n\r\nof course, the echarts official can further modify the rationality of this configuration item, so that you don't have to think about this problem when you use it.", 'reactions': {'url': bar.\r\n[offset](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis.offset) is one way to fix that, but _offset_ is in pixels and it makes the chart unresponsive on resize. To make your issue understood by more people and get helped, we'd like to suggest using English next time. 🤗\n<details><summary><b>TRANSLATED</b></summary><br>\n\n**TITLE**\n\n[Feature] Some suggestions for preserving sampling details\n\n**BODY**\n\n### What problem does this feature solve?\n\nWe have 2 demand scenarios:\r\n1. 16 temperature curves are rendered in a separate dom. Each curve may have up to 30,000 points, and the data is refreshed every 1s.\r\n2. 3 curves are rendered in separate dom, 2 of which may have up to 30,000 points, and the third curve may have up to 60,000 points, and the data is refreshed every 500ms.\r\n\r\nScenario 1 requires that details are not lost as much as possible and is sensitive to high and low temperature locations. Currently, the new minmax algorithm of 5.6.0-rc.1 is used, and the amplification may be different from that without sampling.\r\nScenario 2 uses the new minmax algorithm of 5.6.0-rc.1 to basically meet the needs.\r\n\r\nIt is recommended that after you turn on sampling, if you zoom in and the number of points in the zoomed display area <= the maximum number of points that can be rendered, use the original data for rendering.\r\n\r\nOr you can dynamically sample according to the zoom factor, which can better preserve details.\n\n### What does the proposed API look like?\n\nNo changes to the API or adding configurable items.\n</details>", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2561637795/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, @touchstart="touchStart" @touchmove="touchMove"\r\n    @touchend="touchEnd" style="height: 300px; width: 100%">\r\n  </canvas>\r\n</template>\r\n\r\n<script setup>\r\nimport { defineProps, onMounted, ref } from \'vue\';\r\nimport Taro from "@tarojs/taro";\r\nimport WxCanvas from \'./WxCanvas\';\r\nimport echarts from \'./echarts.min.js\';\r\n\r\n// 定义props\r\nconst props = defineProps({\r\n  canvasId: {\r\n    type: String,\r\n    default: \'\'\r\n  },\r\n  ec: {\r\n    type: Object,\r\n    default: null\r\n  }\r\n});\r\n\r\nconst canvasNode = ref(null);\r\nconst chart = ref(null);\r\n\r\n// 组件初始化\r\nonMounted(() => {\r\n  echarts.registerPreprocessor(option => {\r\n    if (option && option.series) {\r\n      if (option.series.length > 0) {\r\n        option.series.forEach(series => {\r\n          series.progressive = 0;\r\n        });\r\n      } else if (typeof option.series === \'object\') {\r\n        option.series.progressive = 0;\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n  });\r\n\r\n  // 检查是否传递了ec数据\r\n  if (!props.ec) {\r\n    console.warn(\'组件需绑定 ec 变量，例：<ec-canvas id="mychart-dom-bar" canvas-id="mychart-bar" ec="{{ ec }}"></ec-canvas>\');\r\n    return;\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  // 如果没有 lazyLoad，调用初始化\r\n  if (!props.ec.lazyLoad) {\r\n    init();\r\n  }\r\n});\r\n\r\n// 初始化图表\r\nfunction init() {\r\n  const query = Taro.createSelectorQuery();\r\n  query.select(\'.ec-canvas\')\r\n    .fields({ node: true, size: true })\r\n    .exec(res => {\r\n      if (!res || res.length === 0 || res[0].node === null) {\r\n        console.error(\'未获取到canvas的dom节点,请确认在页面渲染完成后或节点,taro中页面渲染完成的生命周期是useReady\');\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const canvasNodeElement = res[0].node;\r\n      const canvasDpr = Taro.getSystemInfoSync().pixelRatio;\r\n      const canvasWidth = res[0].width;\r\n      const canvasHeight = res[0].height;\r\n\r\n      const ctx = canvasNodeElement.getContext("2d");\r\n      const canvas = new WxCanvas(ctx, props.canvasId, true, canvasNodeElement);\r\n      echarts.setCanvasCreator(() => canvas);\r\n\r\n      if (typeof props.ec.onInit === "function") {\r\n        chart.value = props.ec.onInit(canvas, canvasWidth, canvasHeight, canvasDpr);\r\n      } else {\r\n        // 如果没有传递 onInit，可以触发init事件\r\n        props.ec.onInit?.(canvas, canvasWidth, canvasHeight, canvasDpr);\r\n      }\r\n    });\r\n}\r\n\r\n// canvas触摸事件\r\nfunction touchStart(e) {\r\n  if (chart.value && e.touches.length > 0) {\r\n    const touch = e.touches[0];\r\n    const handler = chart.value.getZr().handler;\r\n    handler.dispatch(\'mousedown\', { zrX: touch.x, zrY: touch.y });\r\n    handler.dispatch(\'mousemove\', { zrX: touch.x, zrY: touch.y });\r\n    handler.processGesture(wrapTouch(e), "start");\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction touchMove(e) {\r\n  if (chart.value && e.touches.length > 0) {\r\n    const touch = e.touches[0];\r\n    const handler = chart.value.getZr().handler;\r\n    handler.dispatch(\'mousemove\', { zrX: touch.x, zrY: touch.y });\r\n    handler.processGesture(wrapTouch(e), "change");\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction touchEnd(e) {\r\n  if (chart.value) {\r\n    const touch = e.changedTouches ? e.changedTouches[0] : {};\r\n    const handler = chart.value.getZr().handler;\r\n    handler.dispatch(\'mouseup\', { zrX: touch.x, zrY: touch.y });\r\n    handler.dispatch(\'click\', { zrX: touch.x, zrY: touch.y });\r\n    handler.processGesture(wrapTouch(e), "end");\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction wrapTouch(event) {\r\n  for (let i = 0; i < event.touches.length; ++i) {\r\n    const touch = event.touches[i];\r\n    touch.offsetX = touch.x;\r\n    touch.offsetY = touch.y;\r\n  }\r\n  return event;\r\n}\r\n</script>\r\n\r\n<style scoped>\r\n.ec-canvas {\r\n  width: 100%;\r\n  height: 100%;\r\n}\r\n</style>\r\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2556324968/reactions', There are two map series defined, but their data is **auto-merged** into one (=bug!). The first _visualMap_ controls it. The second _visualMap_ controls nothing since there is no second map.\r\nDocumentation should be updated to say _"Only one map series allowed without geo defined. And each geo area is limited to only one map series"_. \r\n\r\nOTOH, using _geo_ is a good idea - _geo_ acts like _grid_ and we can have multiple _geo_ areas superimposed - When `tooltip.trigger = item`, `params` is the series data of the current hover. When `tooltip.trigger = axis`, `params` is an array. Contains all series data\r\n\r\nI need to display all the series information in the tooltip when `tooltip.trigger = item`, so I hope that when `tooltip.trigger = item`, I can also get all the series data\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nThe `tooltip.formatter` method accepts a params. When `tooltip.trigger = item`, `params` is the series data of the current hover. When `tooltip.trigger = axis`, `params` is an array containing all series data.\r\n\r\nI need to display all series info in the tooltip when `tooltip.trigger = item`, so I hope to get all series data when `tooltip.trigger = item`.\n\n### What does the proposed API look like?\n\nWhen `trigger = 'item'` you can add a context parameter:\r\n```ts\r\ntooltip: {\r\n  trigger: 'item',\r\n  formatter: (params, context) => {\r\n    console.log(context);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n```\n</details>", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2536823983/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': {'id': 20872, 'client_id': 'Iv1.c20ef54d3abcb0e9', 'slug': 'echarts-bot', 'node_id': 'MDM6QXBwMjA4NzI=', 'owner': {'login': 'Ovilia', 'id': 779050, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjc3OTA1MA==', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/779050?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Ovilia', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'ECharts Bot', 'description': "Hi, I'm a Bot for the ECharts project!\r\n\r\nI'm optimistic, diligent, and always willing to help.\r\nI love pizza, dreaming, and traveling... 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '> two additional observations:\r\n> \r\n>     * the problem disappears when _option.dataZoom_ is removed\r\n> \r\n>     * the [official It relies on a custom handler triggered by the `datazoom` event which then sets the correct `start` and `end` for the correct `dataZoom` slider. The following snippet may help people having the same issue or even fixing the bug in the codebase. I will also try to find some time, maybe I can contribute with a PR.\r\n\r\n```js\r\n// Event Handlers\r\n  const handleDataZoom = (e: SyntheticEvent) => {\r\n    const chart = getInstanceByDom(chartRef.current)\r\n\r\n    // @ts-ignore getOption is poorly typed, it should return an array of the yAxis\r\n    const firstIndexWithSetRange = chart.getOption().yAxis.findIndex((yAxis) => {\r\n      // Utilizing == here, as this is an appropriate way to check if it is null OR undefined (nullish and not falsy)\r\n      return !(yAxis.min == null) && !(yAxis.max == null)\r\n    })\r\n    // The toolbox datazoom has a batch at its event, which carries the start and end\r\n    // of all axes that are controlled by it.\r\n    if (firstIndexWithSetRange !== -1 && e.hasOwnProperty('batch')) {\r\n      // I totally dislike this approach as we are looking for magic strings\r\n      // and generally this seems kind of hacky. But I think this is the best\r\n      // fix for the overall problem. Hopefully Echarts does simply fix the zoom via the toolbox.\r\n      // @ts-ignore We check for the existence of this prop in the if-clause\r\n      const yAxisEventForSetRangeAxis = e.batch.find((dataZoomEvent) => {\r\n        return dataZoomEvent.dataZoomId.includes(`yAxis${firstIndexWithSetRange}`)\r\n      })\r\n      const accordingYAxisToEventMaxValue = chart.getOption().yAxis[firstIndexWithSetRange].max\r\n      chart.dispatchAction({\r\n        type: 'dataZoom',\r\n        dataZoomIndex: chart\r\n          .getOption()\r\n          // @ts-ignore As already mentioned, dataZoom is poorly typed\r\n          .dataZoom.findIndex((dataZoomObj) => dataZoomObj?.id === DATA_ZOOM_Y_AXIS_ID),\r\n        start: (yAxisEventForSetRangeAxis.startValue / accordingYAxisToEventMaxValue) * 100,\r\n        end: (yAxisEventForSetRangeAxis.endValue / accordingYAxisToEventMaxValue) * 100,\r\n      })\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n```\r\nBe aware that this is just the handler itself as it fits in our company context. The important part is getting `e.batch`, calculating the `start` and `end` percentages and setting it via `dispatchAction()`", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2538376352/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

Issue #20574: Labels: support, topic: bar

All typescript 5.8, 5.7 and 5.6 doesn't work. Downgrading to typescript 5.5 works. This error occurs because TypeScript version > 5.5 enforces stricter rules regarding export = in ESM modules. The echarts library is using the export = syntax, which is incompatible.\n\n```\nError: node_modules/echarts/index.d.ts:23:1 - error TS1203: Export assignment cannot be used when targeting ECMAScript modules. Consider using 'export default' or another module format instead.\n\n23 export = echarts;\n```", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2717954564/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2724204790', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20554#issuecomment-2724204790', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20554', 'id': 2724204790, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6iYBD2', 'user': {'login': 'Lemmingh', 'id': 43396014, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjQzMzk2MDE0', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/43396014?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Lemmingh', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Lemmingh/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-03-14T09:57:28Z', 'updated_at': '2025-03-14T09:57:28Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '> ```json\n> {\n>   "module": "NodeNext",\n>   "moduleResolution": "NodeNext"\n> }\n> ```\n>\n> ```yaml\n> - Framework: vue3 + vite\n> ```\n\n**This config looks like a mismatch**, and I believe it is a critical cause.\n\n---\n\nThe TypeScript docs says:\n\n> *[The module output format](<https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/modules/theory.html#the-module-output-format>)*\n>\n> While the emitted JavaScript for an all-ESM Node.js project might look identical between compilations using `esnext` and `nodenext`, **the type checking can differ**.\n\n> *[`nodenext`](<https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/modules/reference.html#node16-node18-nodenext>)*\n>\n> describe versions of **Node.js** that *support* ES modules, not just projects that *use* ES modules.\n\n---\n\nThe [Vue\'s recommended TSConfig](<https://github.com/vuejs/tsconfig/blob/main/tsconfig.json>) says:\n\n```jsonc\n{\n  "compilerOptions": {\n    // As long as you are using a build tool, we recommend you to author and ship in ES modules.\n    // Even if you are targeting Node.js, because\n    //  - `CommonJS` is too outdated\n    //  - the ecosystem hasn\'t fully caught up with `Node16`/`NodeNext`\n    // This recommendation includes environments like Vitest, Vite Config File, Vite SSR, etc.\n    "module": "ESNext",\n\n    // We expect users to use bundlers.\n    // So here we enable some resolution features that are only available in bundlers.\n    "moduleResolution": "bundler",\n\n    // A few notes:\n    // - Vue 3 supports ES2016+\n    // - For Vite, the actual compilation target is determined by the\n    //   `build.target` option in the Vite config.\n    //   So don\'t change the `target` field here. It has to be\n    //   at least `ES2020` for dynamic `import()`s and `import.meta` to work correctly.\n    // - If you are not using Vite, feel free to overwrite the `target` field.\n    "target": "ESNext"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\nIndeed, if you create a Vue 3 project using the [official scaffold](<https://vuejs.org/guide/quick-start.html#creating-a-vue-application>), which includes the aforementioned TSConfig recommendation, [your import statements](<https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20554#issue-2714521416>) work fine.\n\n```shell\npnpm create vue@latest --typescript ref-proj\ncd ref-proj\npnpm add echarts@~5.6.0\n```\n\n```typescript\nimport { use } from "echarts/core";\n\nimport { BarChart, CustomChart, GaugeChart, LineChart, PieChart, SankeyChart } from "echarts/charts";\nimport { BrushComponent, DataZoomComponent, GridComponent, LegendComponent, MarkLineComponent, ToolboxComponent, TooltipComponent } from "echarts/components";\nimport { CanvasRenderer } from "echarts/renderers";\n\nuse([BarChart, CustomChart, GaugeChart, LineChart, PieChart, SankeyChart, BrushComponent, DataZoomComponent, GridComponent, LegendComponent, MarkLineComponent, ToolboxComponent, TooltipComponent, CanvasRenderer]);\n```\n\nType-checking succeeds with no error.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2724204790/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

The problems of the chart are the bar width is inappropriate and the x-axis does not show the defined timeframe (from "2024-11-21" to  "2024-11-28").   \r\n\r\nFor your information, I have tried to set the barWidth to "_x%_" in order to achieve the "_Appropriate width_" in this case. However, if the barWidth is set to "3%", when the chart is set with shorter period (e.g. from "2024-11-21" to  "2024-11-25") , the bars will be too slim.  (https://tinyurl.com/3wwjrak7)\r\n\r\nOn the other hand, when the chart is set with larger period (e.g. from "2024-11-21" to  "2024-12-31"), the bars will span accross other dates too.  In this URL (https://tinyurl.com/5c3tmer5), the data on  "2024-11-22" still spans to  "2024-11-21" and  "2024-11-23". \r\n\r\nMoreover, when the chart has no missing data, the barWidth with "3%" will be too slim. (https://tinyurl.com/ycyjd9uu) \r\n\r\nThe bar width should be _adaptive_ and the x-axis period should always show the defined min and max value.', 'reactions': {'url': However, the options here are spliced using a program, and replacing the element order of the series in the end seems unreasonable. (More recommended, as it doesn\'t really need reactivity)\r\n\r\n```diff\r\n- const chart = ref(null); \r\n+ let chart = null\r\n\r\nconst updateChart = () => {\r\n-  chart.value.setOption({\r\n+  chart.setOption({\r\n    // ...\r\n  })\r\n})\r\n\r\nonMounted(() => {\r\n- chart.value = echarts.init(document.getElementById("main"), "dark");\r\n+ chart = echarts.init(document.getElementById("main"), "dark");\r\n  updateChart();\r\n});\r\n\r\n// Don\'t forget to dispose the chart instance when the component is destroyed\r\n+ onBeforeUnmount(() => {\r\n+   if (chart) {\r\n+     chart.dispose()\r\n+     chart = null\r\n+   }\r\n+ })\r\n```\r\n\r\nSee also other similar issues 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "@helgasoft I appreciate your proposed workaround, but it is not a complete solution and I still believe this is a bug for these reasons:\r\n- Your approach to be plotted.  The 'paint over' area would overlap all series.\r\n- The docs allow for `y: [a,b]` as an exceptable syntax.  If the `y` param cannot in fact handle or do anything with an array, then it should throw an error in this case.\r\n\r\nAn ideal solution may allow you to specify the line and area in a single series configuration, as opposed to the 2 above, for example. :\r\n```\r\noption = {\r\n  dataset: {\r\n    source: data\r\n  },\r\n  xAxis: { type: 'category' },\r\n  yAxis: { type: 'value' },\r\n  series: [\r\n    {\r\n      type: 'line',\r\n      encode: { x: 0, y: [3, 1, 2] }, // specify line first, then upper, lower bounds of area\r\n      name: 'Min-Max Range',\r\n      areaStyle: { opacity: 0.25 }, // Enable area fill\r\n      lineStyle: { opacity: 1 }, // show the avg line\r\n      symbol: 'none'\r\n    }\r\n  ]\r\n};\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe best alternative we've been able to utilize thus far is plotting data points as a scatter and then showing the average through line as 2 series.  This is not our preferred format however, 'confidence bands' would be better.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2479937984/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2482185231', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20521#issuecomment-2482185231', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20521', 'id': 2482185231, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6T8yQP', 'user': {'login': 'Ovilia', 'id': 779050, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjc3OTA1MA==', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/779050?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Ovilia', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2024-11-18T07:49:46Z', 'updated_at': '2024-11-18T07:49:46Z', 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': "You may need to wait until v6.0 releases so that you can use the new [lineRange](https://github.com/apache/echarts-custom-series/tree/main/custom-series/lineRange) custom series. \r\n\r\nSSR with canvas render not support animation.  disable it, the image will be right.\r\n\r\nTry `animation: false`.\r\n\r\nAll options are below\r\n\r\n```js\r\n{\r\n  title: {\r\n    text: "10.01-10.15日活每日增长趋势",\r\n  },\r\n  animation: false,\r\n  tooltip: {},\r\n  legend: {\r\n    data: ["活跃数"],\r\n    bottom: "10",\r\n  },\r\n  xAxis: {\r\n    data: [\r\n      "2024-10-1",\r\n      "2024-10-2",\r\n      "2024-10-3",\r\n      "2024-10-4",\r\n      "2024-10-5",\r\n      "2024-10-6",\r\n      "2024-10-7",\r\n      "2024-10-8",\r\n      "2024-10-9",\r\n      "2024-10-10",\r\n "line",\r\n      data: [\r\n        86, 38, 45, 37, 37, 37, 60, 589, 545, 653, 891, 838, 225, 708, 597,\r\n      ],\r\n      label: {\r\n        show: true, // 显示每个数据点的标签\r\n        position: "top", // 标签的位置，可以是 \'top\', \'left\', \'right\', \'bottom\'\r\n        formatter: "{c}", // 显示数据的值\r\n      },\r\n    },\r\n  ],\r\n}\r\n```', 'reactions': {'url': Create a chart\r\n2. Configure axisTick.customValues\r\n`\r\naxisTick: {\r\nalignWithLabel: true,\r\ncustomValues: [10, 100, 1000, 10000, 100000, 1000000]\r\n},\r\n`\r\n![1731312507168](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/693abe99-52da-4dd9-856b-bf4e1787fc87)\r\n\r\n3. After axisLabel.formatter is set, the display cannot be based on the value set by axisTick.customValues.\n\n### Expected Behavior\n\nRegardless of whether axisLabel.formatter is set, it will be displayed based on the value set by axisTick.customValues.\n\n### Environment\n\n```markdown\n- OS: win10\r\n- Browser: chrome 130.0.6723.92\r\n- Framework:\n```\n\n\n### Any additional comments?\n\n_No response_\n</details>", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2467490033/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': {'id': 20872, 'client_id': 'Iv1.c20ef54d3abcb0e9', 'slug': 'echarts-bot', 'node_id': 'MDM6QXBwMjA4NzI=', 'owner': {'login': 'Ovilia', 'id': 779050, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjc3OTA1MA==', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/779050?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/Ovilia', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/Ovilia/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'ECharts Bot', 'description': "Hi, I'm a Bot for the ECharts project!\r\n\r\nI'm optimistic, diligent, and always willing to help.\r\nI love pizza, dreaming, and traveling... 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': 'Some memos:\r\n\r\n+ Found that at present echarts only uses `__extends` function of tslib. (by searching `from "tslib` in echarts/lib.).\r\n+ About bundle size: After tree shaking (tested in vite@6.0.0-beta.9, `tsc -b && vite build`), only used functions of tslib will be included in bundle. That is only `__extends` (and `extendStatics`, which is called by `__extends` internally) is included. So the bundle size is probably not a concern till now.\r\n+ Compatibility if changing to `"tslib": "^x.x.x"`: Checked the commit log of `__extends` on git, there\'s no breaking. Thus this change does not break echarts. \r\n+ Use different versions of tslib in one JS context: (tested in vite@6.0.0-beta.9, `tsc -b && vite build`) , the built bundle is like this :\r\n    ```js\r\n    // At the top scope of the bundle file dist/assets/index-JsGP8STl.js\r\n    // Two tslib are included but the name are modified to avoid conflict.\r\n    var extendStatics$1 = function(d, b) { /* ... */ };\r\n    function __extends$1(d, b) { /* ... */ }\r\n    /* ... */\r\n    var extendStatics = function(d, b) { /* ... */ };\r\n    function __extends(d, b) { /* ... */ }\r\n    ```\r\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2472880033/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

If not, the total value could be not as expected. ECharts filters invalid data so that the rest can be displayed. There is no reason to print an error log and renders nothing when there is a negative value. You should be responsible for your input to make sure it's valid all the time. Otherwise, there is possibility that you get expected result with valid input before your presentation and then when in presentation, the data dynamically changed and have negative ones.", 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '谢谢你们的帮助，这是我最后需要的东西\r\n```html\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html lang="en">\r\n<head>\r\n    <meta charset="UTF-8">\r\n    <meta name="viewport"\r\n          content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">\r\n    <title>ECharts Example</title>\r\n    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/echarts/5.3.3/echarts.min.js"></script>\r\n    <style>\r\n        #main {\r\n            width: 600px;\r\n            height: 400px;\r\n        }\r\n    </style>\r\n</head>\r\n<body>\r\n<div id="main"></div>\r\n<script>\r\n    // ref page\r\n    // https://echarts.apache.org/zh/tutorial.html#%E8%87%AA%E5%AE%9A%E4%B9%89%E7%B3%BB%E5%88%97\r\n    const myChart = echarts.init(document.getElementById(\'main\'));\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * renderItem函数\r\n     */\r\n    function myRender(params, api) {\r\n        // 获取当前数据点的索引\r\n        let currentIndex = params.dataIndexInside;\r\n\r\n        // 当前点的坐标\r\n        // 这里使用 api.coord(...) 将数值在当前坐标系中转换成为屏幕上的点的像素值。\r\n        let startPoint = api.coord([api.value(0, currentIndex), api.value(1, currentIndex)]);\r\n\r\n        // 获取下一个数据点的坐标（确保不越界）\r\n        let nextIndex = currentIndex + 1;\r\n        let endPoint = nextIndex < data.length ? api.coord([api.value(0, nextIndex), api.value(1, nextIndex)]) : startPoint;\r\n\r\n        // 获取颜色（根据类型选择红色或绿色）\r\n        let color = api.value(2, currentIndex) === "高风险" ? "red" : "green";\r\n\r\n        const child1 = {\r\n            type: "line",\r\n            shape: {\r\n                x1: startPoint[0],\r\n                y1: startPoint[1],\r\n                x2: endPoint[0],\r\n                y2: startPoint[1]\r\n            },\r\n            style: {stroke: color, lineWidth: 2}\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        const child2 = {\r\n            type: "line",\r\n            shape: {\r\n                x1: endPoint[0],\r\n                y1: startPoint[1],\r\n                x2: endPoint[0],\r\n                y2: endPoint[1]\r\n            },\r\n            style: {stroke: \'green\', lineWidth: 2}\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // 如果不是最后一个点，则返回一个 group 包含两个子元素\r\n        if (nextIndex < data.length - 1) {\r\n            // 创建一个 group 来包含多个元素\r\n            // 返回整个 group 对象\r\n            return {\r\n                type: "group",  // 指定为 group 类型\r\n                children: [\r\n                    // 绘制第一个水平线段\r\n                    child1,\r\n                    // 绘制第二个垂直线段\r\n                    child2\r\n                ]\r\n            };\r\n        } else {\r\n            // 绘制第一个水平线段\r\n            return child1\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    const data = [\r\n        [\'00:00\', 100, "高风险"],\r\n        [\'01:15\', 200, "一般风险"],\r\n        [\'02:30\', 300, "高风险"],\r\n        [\'03:45\', 400, "一般风险"]\r\n    ];\r\n\r\n    const option = {\r\n        title: {\r\n            text: \'Distribution of Electricity\',\r\n            subtext: \'Fake Data\'\r\n        },\r\n        tooltip: {\r\n            trigger: \'axis\',\r\n            axisPointer: {\r\n                type: \'cross\'\r\n            }\r\n        },\r\n        toolbox: {\r\n            show: true,\r\n            feature: {\r\n                saveAsImage: {}\r\n            }\r\n        },\r\n        xAxis: {\r\n            type: \'category\',\r\n        },\r\n        yAxis: {\r\n            type: \'value\',\r\n            axisLabel: {\r\n                formatter: \'{value} pcs\'\r\n            },\r\n            axisPointer: {\r\n                snap: true\r\n            }\r\n        },\r\n        series: [\r\n            {\r\n                name: \'Electricity\',\r\n                type: \'custom\',\r\n                renderItem: myRender,\r\n                data: data\r\n            }\r\n        ]\r\n    };\r\n\r\n    myChart.setOption(option);\r\n\r\n</script>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n```', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2458883476/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': "> I'm not sure about if we should change like this. Is it expected to show fill color instead of stroke color in large scale bars? A reason to say NO for me is that the stoke width is a fixed width (etc. 1px) while the bar width is relatively quite small when in large scale bars, far less than 1px. So I would prefer to expect showing border color in this case.\r\n\r\nHi @Ovilia, thank you for your review! I believe that the expected behavior for a user is that: changing the border color should only affect the border even in large data, resulting in a bar with a distinct inner color and outer border. However in this case, since that is not possibile (like you said for very small width) with larger datasets, you end up with a single color and that can be quite messy. In this example: applying a black border:\r\n![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c4be02f-e5c9-4582-9049-645ca6a7bd82)\r\n\r\nA possible solution might be to ignore user-defined colors at high data density, displaying the chart as if no borderColor is specified. This would revert to a simpler, default color scheme for clarity. And on zoom to less dense data, apply the correct property. What do you think about this? The default color is this:\r\n![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b93495f9-f407-4ba5-a4a3-0e498d7f9cb2)\r\n\r\n@nico-robert what behavior did you expect?\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n", To make your issue understood by more people and get helped, we\'d like to suggest using English next time. 🤗\n<details><summary><b>TRANSLATED</b></summary><br>\n\n**TITLE**\n\n[Bug] Real-time curve, when you leave the echarts page and open it for 1~2 minutes, you go back to the echart page to view the data, and find that the data of the left period is not updated or lost\n\n**BODY**\n\n### Version\n\n4.9.0\n\n### Link to Minimal Reproduction\n\nhttps://jsfiddle.net/coderun/vhxcf2mt/3/\n\n### Steps to Reproduce\n\n```\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html>\r\n<head>\r\n<meta charset="utf-8">\r\n<title>Echarts Demo</title>\r\n\t\t\r\n<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/echarts@4.9.0/dist/echarts.min.js"></script>\r\n</head>\r\n<body>\r\n\t\t\r\n<div id="chart" style="width: 600px; height: 400px;"></div>\r\n<div id="avg">\r\n<div id="app_avg">app average:</div>\r\n<div id="system_avg">system average:</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<button onclick="exportData()">Get interval data</button>\r\n</div>\r\n<script>\r\n//Initialize chart\r\nvar myChart = echarts.init(document.getElementById(\'chart\'));\r\n// Generate random numbers\r\nfunction generateRandomValue() {\r\nreturn Math.floor(Math.random() * 100);\r\n}\r\n//Set the configuration items and data of the chart\r\nvar option = {\r\ntitle: {\r\nname: \'CPU\',\r\nleft: \'center\'\r\n},\r\nlegend: {\r\norient: \'horizontal\',\r\nx: \'right\', //The legend can be set to the left, right, or center\r\ny: \'top\', //The legend can be set to top, bottom, or center\r\ndata: [\'Private\', \'Real\']\r\n},\r\ntooltip: {\r\ntrigger: \'axis\',\r\naxisPointer: {\r\nanimation: false\r\n},\r\n},\r\nxAxis: {\r\ntype: \'time\',\r\naxisLabel: {\r\nformatter: function(value) {\r\nvar date = new Date(value);\r\nvar hours = date.getHours();\r\nvar minutes = "0" + date.getMinutes();\r\nvar seconds = "0" + date.getSeconds();\r\nreturn hours + \':\' + minutes.substr(-2) + \':\' + seconds.substr(-2);\r\n}\r\n}\r\n},\r\nyAxis: {\r\ntype: \'value\'\r\n},\r\ndataZoom: [{\r\ntype: \'slider\',\r\nshow: true,\r\nxAxisIndex: [0],\r\nstart: 0,\r\nend: 100,\r\n},\r\n{\r\ntype: \'inside\',\r\nshow: true,\r\nxAxisIndex: [0],\r\nstart: 0,\r\nend: 100,\r\n}\r\n],\r\nseries: [{\r\nname: \'app\',\r\ndata: [],\r\ntype: \'line\',\r\n},\r\n{\r\nname: \'system\',\r\ndata: [],\r\ntype: \'line\'\r\n}\r\n]\r\n};\r\n//Use configuration items and data to display charts\r\nmyChart.setOption(option);\r\nlet app_data = [];\r\nlet system_data = [];\r\nlet lastUpdateTime = Date.now();\r\n\r\nfunction updateData(time) {\r\nvar now = time || new Date(); // Use the passed in time or the current time\r\nvar app_value = {\r\nname: now.toString(),\r\nvalue: [\r\nnow,\r\ngenerateRandomValue(),\r\n]\r\n};\r\nvar system_value = {\r\nname: now.toString(),\r\nvalue: [\r\nnow,\r\ngenerateRandomValue(),\r\n]\r\n};\r\napp_data.push(app_value);\r\nsystem_data.push(system_value);\r\nmyChart.setOption({\r\nseries: [{\r\nname: \'app\',\r\ndata: app_data,\r\ntype: \'line\',\r\nmarkPoint: {\r\ndata: app_data.length != 0 ? [{\r\ntype: \'max\',\r\nname: \'maximum value\'\r\n},\r\n{\r\ntype: \'min\',\r\nname: \'minimum value\'\r\n},\r\n{\r\ntype: \'point\',\r\nname: \'current value\',\r\nvalue: app_value.value[1],\r\nxAxis: app_value.value[0],\r\nyAxis: app_value.value[1]\r\n}\r\n] : [],\r\nlabel: {\r\nposition: \'inside\',\r\nformatter: function(param) {\r\nif (param.data.type != \'point\') {\r\nreturn param.data.type + ":" + param.value\r\n}\r\n}\r\n}\r\n},\r\nmarkLine: {\r\ndata: [{\r\ntype: \'average\',\r\nname: \'average\'\r\n}],\r\nlabel: {\r\nformatter: function(param) {\r\nreturn "avg:" + param.value\r\n}\r\n}\r\n}\r\n},\r\n{\r\nname: \'system\',\r\ndata: system_data,\r\ntype: \'line\',\r\nmarkPoint: {\r\ndata: system_data.length != 0 ? [{\r\ntype: \'max\',\r\nname: \'maximum value\'\r\n},\r\n{\r\ntype: \'min\',\r\nname: \'minimum value\'\r\n},\r\n{\r\ntype: \'point\',\r\nname: \'current value\',\r\nvalue: system_value.value[1],\r\nxAxis: system_value.value[0],\r\nyAxis: system_value.value[1]\r\n}\r\n] : [],\r\nlabel: {\r\nposition: \'inside\',\r\nformatter: function(param) {\r\nif (param.data.type != \'point\') {\r\nreturn param.data.type + ":" + param.value\r\n}\r\n}\r\n}\r\n},\r\nmarkLine: {\r\ndata: [{\r\ntype: \'average\',\r\nname: \'average\'\r\n}],\r\nlabel: {\r\nformatter: function(param) {\r\nreturn "avg:" + param.value\r\n}\r\n}\r\n}\r\n}\r\n]\r\n});\r\nlastUpdateTime = Date.now();\r\n}\r\n//Update data every second\r\nvar intervalId = setInterval(updateData, 1000);\r\nlisten_dataZoom(myChart);\r\n\r\nfunction listen_dataZoom(chart) {\r\nchart.on(\'dataZoom\', function(params) {\r\nlet startIndex = Math.floor(params.start * chart.getOption().series[0].data.length / 100);\r\nlet endIndex = Math.floor(params.end * chart.getOption().series[0].data.length / 100);\r\nchart.getOption().series.forEach(function(series) {\r\nlet sum = 0;\r\nlet count = endIndex - startIndex;\r\nfor (var i = startIndex; i < endIndex; i++) {\r\nsum += series.data[i].value[1];\r\n}\r\nlet avg = sum / count;\r\nif (series.name === \'app\') {\r\napp_avg.innerHTML = "app average:" + avg.toFixed(2);\r\n} else if (series.name === \'system\') {\r\nsystem_avg.innerHTML = "system average:" + avg.toFixed(2);\r\n}\r\n})\r\n});\r\n};\r\n// Save and restore data when the page gains and loses focus\r\ndocument.addEventListener(\'visibilitychange\', function () {\r\nif (document. hidden) {\r\nlocalStorage.setItem(\'echartsData\', JSON.stringify(data));\r\n} else {\r\nvar savedData = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(\'echartsData\'));\r\nif (savedData) {\r\ndata = savedData;\r\nmyChart.setOption({\r\nseries: [{\r\ndata: data\r\n}]\r\n});\r\n}\r\n}\r\n});\r\n</script>\r\n</body>\r\n</html>\r\n```\r\n<img width="628" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fdf0f168-e011-4f73-9761-62af6af62a8f">\r\n\n\n### Current Behavior\n\nData is lost after leaving the page\n\n### Expected Behavior\n\nThe program is still running and the data should continue to load.\n\n### Environment\n\n```markdown\n-OS:\r\n-Browser:\r\n- Framework:\n```\n\n\n### Any additional comments?\n\n_No response_\n</details>', Issue #20445: Labels: new-feature, pending, en
Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2466208339', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/20445#issuecomment-2466208339', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/20445', 'id': 2466208339, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOAIwqAM6S_1pT', 'user': {'login': 'mole422', 'id': 181309354, 'node_id': 'U_kgDOCs6Pqg', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/181309354?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/mole422', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/mole422/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2024-11-09T13:06:43Z', 'updated_at': '2024-11-09T13:23:29Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "# Solution to the Sankey Diagram Line Occlusion Problem\r\n\r\n## Problem Description\r\n\r\nIn some cases, the lines (flows) between nodes in a Sankey diagram may become occluded, making them invisible or unclear. This issue typically arises in two scenarios:\r\n\r\n1. **Node Occlusion**: When there are many nodes or the nodes are placed too close together, some flow paths may be hidden, affecting readability.\r\n2. **Invisible Lines**: If the lines between nodes are very thin or if the path curvature is not set properly, the lines might become nearly invisible.\r\n\r\n## Solution\r\n\r\nTo resolve the issue of occluded lines, we can adjust the minimum distance between nodes to improve the visualization of the flow lines. The proposed solution is to introduce a new API parameter called `minimumMidpointDistance`, which controls the minimum distance between the flow path's midpoint and the nodes, ensuring that the lines remain visible and are not hidden by other nodes.\r\n\r\n### API Parameter\r\n\r\n- **`minimumMidpointDistance`**: This parameter is used to control the minimum distance between the midpoint of a flow path and the nodes. It can be:\r\n  - **Absolute value**: For example, `30`, meaning the minimum distance is 30 pixels.\r\n  - **Relative value**: For example, `'20%'`, meaning the minimum distance is 20% of the total width of the chart.\r\n\r\nBy adjusting this parameter, you can ensure that the lines have enough space to be visible, preventing them from being occluded by other nodes.\r\n\r\n### Example\r\n\r\nHere’s an example of how to use `minimumMidpointDistance`:\r\n\r\n```js\r\noption = {\r\n  series: {\r\n    type: 'sankey',\r\n    layout: 'none',\r\n    emphasis: {\r\n      focus: 'adjacency'\r\n    },\r\n    layoutIterations: 0,\r\n    data: [\r\n      {\r\n        name: 'prod1',\r\n        depth: 0\r\n      },\r\n      {\r\n        name: 'prod2',\r\n        depth: 0\r\n      },\r\n      {\r\n        name: 'prod3',\r\n        depth: 0\r\n      }\r\n    ],\r\n    links: [\r\n      {\r\n        source: 'prod1',\r\n        target: 'prod2',\r\n        value: 30,\r\n        lineStyle: {\r\n          curveness: 1,\r\n          minimumMidpointDistance: 30 // Prevent line occlusion by setting a minimum distance\r\n        },\r\n      },\r\n      {\r\n        source: 'prod1',\r\n        target: 'prod3',\r\n        value: 30,\r\n        lineStyle: {\r\n          curveness: 1,\r\n          minimumMidpointDistance: 30 // Same adjustment for this line\r\n        },\r\n      },\r\n      {\r\n        source: 'prod1',\r\n        target: 'prod3',\r\n        lineStyle: {\r\n          curveness: 10,\r\n          minimumMidpointDistance: 30 // Set minimum distance for this line too\r\n        },\r\n        value: 30\r\n      }\r\n    ]\r\n  }\r\n};\r\n\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2466208339/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

true, add an ending tick to the intervalList.\r\n\r\nA potential issue arises if the intervalList is [true, false]. By adding an end tick, it becomes [true, true], which might seem odd.\r\n\r\nA more intelligent way is if the tick is end of axis then add it. if not ignore it. \r\n\r\nShould we use this?\r\n', "positive".\r\n\r\nthe correct order would respect the order of series given, which is;\r\nit should first render "positive" if we give "positive" as the first serie item,\r\nit should first render the "negative" if we give "negative" as the first serie item.\r\n\r\n\r\nand even if you changed the order of series than the same problem still exists in this case;\r\n\r\n```\r\n{\r\n  legend: So when you calling `setOption` for the second time, labelLayout is not provided and thus the old labelLayout is used (merged).\r\n\r\nTo fully reset the series, you need to set a different `series.id` the second time you calling `setOption`, or you can set `notMerge` to be `true` to force not using merging.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2410491693/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

10;\r\nsetInterval(() =>{\r\n  offset--; if (offset < 0) offset = 10;\r\n  mychart.setOption({series: {lineStyle: {dashOffset: offset}}});\r\n}, 150);\r\n```\r\n\r\nIt also is flickering like it would Issue #20403: Labels: bug, pending, en

The z value of the markArea seems to be hard coded and unrelated to the z value of the containing series.\r\n\r\nMarkLine seems to have a higher z value and can be used as an alternative in your case: However the image layout is ```repeat: 'repeat'```, which you probably do not want.\r\nWould be nice to have ```repeat: 'no-repeat'``` (single image) with responsive positioning like CSS ```background-position: center;```, but that is not currently available in API.\r\nA nice new feature candidate for [v.6.0](https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/19959) though! 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': "We are going to provide `series.itemPayload` in ECharts v6. Here's a preview: https://github.com/apache/echarts/blob/v6/test/custom-register.html . v6 is expected to be released earlier next year. If you are interested in using it now, you may check out the `v6` branch.\r\n\r\nBefore v6, you can set the data you need to an outer variable to hold the value. For example:\r\n\r\n```js\r\nconst data = [...];\r\nconst option = {\r\n    series: [{\r\n        type: 'custom',\r\n        data: data,\r\n        renderItem: (params, api) => {\r\n            for (let i = 0; i < params.dataInsideLength; ++i) {\r\n                const xDim = 0;\r\n                const rawData = api.value(xDim, i); // This is how to get data of other index\r\n            }\r\n            // or you may access `data` here\r\n      }\r\n   }]\r\n}\r\n```\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/echarts/issues/comments/2362689979/reactions',
